author: sgala
msg: This and next change address the following problem (reported by definete.com).
When memory cache entry gets created, two broken things happen:
1. No FileWatcher is created until getExpired is called
2. FileWatcher does not fill lastModified upon creation
So, if a file is modified on disk between portlet instantiation and next request,
the portlet will not be expired.
Patch: set lastModified in FileWatcher constructor, and call getExpire in Cacheable creation.
Note: memory cache is very broken. It really needs a rewriting with cleaner interfaces.

author: sgala
msg: Content length test was failing to cache some unchanged URLs due to transcoding effects
(we store cache in utf-8 and content length is not directly comparable if original
resource used other encoding). Test was also mostly broken.

author: kimptoc
msg: bug # 5091  CastorRegistryService.addEntry method fails

author: paulsp
msg: Update documentation to reflect changes in HTMLRewriter

author: paulsp
msg: o Fixed bug in <SCRIPT> processing. Thanks to patch provided by Ozgur Balsoy
o Comments that contain script and style code are now included
o Added "openInNewWindow" parameter to insert TARGET="_BLANK" attribute in <A>.
o Added support for HREF in <BASE>
o Removed support for BACKGROUND attribute in <BODY>
o Removed URL rewriting from VALUE attribute in <OPTION>
o Added default CODEBASE attribute to <APPLET> and <OBJECT>
o General cleanup of import statements
o Added documentation
